thread.title: Fourteen injured as plane bound for Gatwick bursts in flames
thread.title_full: Fourteen injured as plane bound for Gatwick bursts in flames | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Fourteen injured as plane bound for Gatwick bursts in flames
text:
This photo was captured by a passenger on a passing plane on the runway Credit: EricmHays\Twitter More than a dozen people were injured after a plane bound for Gatwick caught fire.
Passengers onboard the British Airways flight were evacuated at Las Vegas airport overnight.
Crew noticed the flames before the plane took off.
Fourteen people have been treated for minor injuries.
VIDEO CREDIT: Balaji Rajgiri
The Federal Aviation Administration said in an emailed statement: "A British Airways Boeing 777 experienced a left engine fire on takeoff at McCarran International Airport.
At a press briefing, the company said the cause of the fire - which began from the plane's left engine during take-off - was not yet known.
An investigation team are arriving to determine what prompted the fire.
Last updated Wed 9 Sep 2015 Read more 8 updates Plane heading for Gatwick bursts into flames Travel
